title: `allowUnlimitedContractSize` doesn't work for deployments within Solidity
body:
Getting the error:

```
 Error: Transaction reverted: trying to deploy a contract whose code is too large
      at MyContract.constructor (contracts/MyContract.sol:65)
      at MyContractFactory.createContract(contracts/MyContractFactory.sol:71)
```

Using latest version: `1.3.8`.

You mean that it does work for deploying contracts from your js code, but not for factories?

If that's the case, I'd report it and fix it in ethereumjs-vm.
@alcuadrado Exactly.
Hey @gorgos, do you have a link to a repo where I can reproduce this?

@alcuadrado Here's an example repo that produces the problem

https://github.com/kendricktan/ethereumjs-vm-factory-unlimited

Thanks for putting up this, @kendricktan!

Something really weird is going on here. I looks like an actual OOG error, that Buidler is encoding poorly. I modified the config little so that the `gas` and `blockGasLimit` are 1000M now, and the transaction runs forever. This makes me think that there's an infinite loop introduced by solidity, or that the VM is seriously broken.

Ok, after tracing the transaction further, it doesn't seem to be an infinite loop, but your contract is actually doing a lot of work.

This isn't an EIP170 error though, as that is related to the size of the runtime bytecode, and not the amount of work done in the constructor. 

Buidler is failing to show this error clearly though. We have to dig deeper to identify why and fix it.
You're right! Bumping the gas up makes it work. Interesting.... Lots of these little gotchas :sweat_smile:

Sorry for the inconvenience, I appreciate you reported it.

Can you keep your reproduction repo until we have time to fix this?

I'm actually seeing this error now even in Truffle fixtures.

`solc v0.6.10`

```
Contract: MyContract
       "before all" hook: Running truffle fixture if available in "Contract: MyContract":
     Error: Transaction reverted: trying to deploy a contract whose code is too large
      at MyContract.constructor (contracts/MyContract.sol:17)
```

`solc v0.6.11`

```
 Contract: MyContract
       "before all" hook: Running truffle fixture if available in "Contract: MyContract":
     Error: Returned error: Transaction run out of gas
```

> I'm actually seeing this error now even in Truffle fixtures.
> 
> `solc v0.6.10`
> 
> ```
> Contract: MyContract
>        "before all" hook: Running truffle fixture if available in "Contract: MyContract":
>      Error: Transaction reverted: trying to deploy a contract whose code is too large
>       at MyContract.constructor (contracts/MyContract.sol:17)
> ```

This may be a bug. Can you help us reproduce it?
@kendricktan Thanks, that actually fixed it. I had left out the `networks` part in the config. 🤦

I have a question. How to deploy such oversized contract on mainnet where the block gas limits to 12,500,000 gas?
IMO, maybe the problem is rooted from the contract  but not the environment settings.

> IMO, maybe the problem is rooted from the contract but not the environment settings.

There are still several reasons why you might have contracts that are too large in Hardhat:

- not using the optimizer to ensure correct stack lines
- a contract still heavily being developed and the downsizing is planned for later
- using a private network with higher gas limits

Still getting this issue

   Contract: LoanTokenLending
       "before each" hook for "test lend to the pool":
     Error: Transaction reverted: trying to deploy a contract whose code is too large.
     
 Actually trying to test contracts but this error is showing on deploying command.
 Is the solution manual setting?

@ztcrypto 

I had this similar issue as of now too. Make sure to also include `blockGasLimit: 0x1fffffffffffff` in the settings, otherwise, nothing else helps. 

Mine looks like this:

```js
hardhat: {
      throwOnTransactionFailures: true,
      throwOnCallFailures: true,
      allowUnlimitedContractSize: true,
      blockGasLimit: 0x1fffffffffffff,
      accounts: accounts()
}
```
Thanks @novaknole I will try again.
I'm not sure if there's something to do on our side here, so I'm going to tentatively close this issue. Please re-open if there's something we can do about this.

Hey, I'm trying to deploy to BSC Testnet using Hardhat and I have added the allowUnlimitedContractSize: true, Optimizer enabled with 200 runs, and put large gas numbers and still getting the `ProviderError: max code size exceeded.`
Is anyone experiencing the same thing?
@samgville that feature is specific to Hardhat Network. It has no effect on live testnets.

@alcuadrado thanks for your reply. I'm curious then how is it possible to see contracts deployed on mainnets that exceed the size limit for each contracts? I've seen some of them use saddle-eth to deploy and apparently they can turn on the AllowUnlimitedContractSize for mainnets.

> apparently they can turn on the AllowUnlimitedContractSize for mainnets.

That's impossible, as that feature doesn't even exist in other chains. it's an ethereumjs thing.

Those contracts are probably compiled with a different version of solc or with different optimizer settings.

For me nothing is working, the whole point of deploying without optimization is to make debugging easier. If you enable optimization the debugger wont work as well. Optimization should only be needed for mainnet...
Locking this conversation as it's misleading people into thinking that there's a bug, when in fact they are just getting out of gas errors.
